title: Trump Says He Will Meet With Putin in Alaska Next Week
summary: Mr. Trump also suggested that a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine would include “some swapping of territories,” signaling that the U.S. may join Russia in trying to compel Ukraine to cede land.

title: What Putin Hopes to Gain From a Summit With Trump
summary: The American leader has agreed to a meeting with the Russian president in Alaska next Friday to discuss ending the war in Ukraine.

title: India’s Modi Left Soul-Searching After Failed Courtships of Xi and Trump
summary: The collapse of the prime minister’s high-stakes efforts to transform ties with the world’s two superpowers has exposed the limits of India’s leverage.

title: Trump Just Shrugs as Kennedy Undermines His Vaccine Legacy
summary: President Trump’s laissez-faire approach is notable, given that the development of the Covid vaccine was seen as one of his first term’s most notable achievements.

title: Trump Is Removing Billy Long as the I.R.S. Head 2 Months After He Was Confirmed
summary: Billy Long, a former Republican congressman, will no longer serve as the tax agency’s head. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent will oversee the agency as acting commissioner.

title: Trump Officials Press Case Against Harvard, and Add New Investigation
summary: The administration doubled down against Harvard, asserting that rising violent crime on campus meant the school should not host international students. It will also review the school’s patents.

title: Suspect and Officer Are Dead After Shooting Outside CDC Near Emory University in Atlanta
summary: The gunman fired at the headquarters of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention because he blamed the Covid vaccine for his maladies, an official said.

title: What Lobsters and Chickens Reveal About Europe’s Trade Strategy
summary: The European Union struck a trade deal that protected political priorities, like chicken and beef standards, while allowing headline-grabbing concessions. Consider lobsters.

title: The Tycoons Who Profit From India’s Thirst for Russian Oil
summary: President Trump’s new front in the trade war against India focuses on a pair of enormous refineries with extraordinary owners.

title: Why Are Tariffs on Switzerland So High?
summary: President Trump sees Switzerland as doing too little to address its trade deficit with the U.S., a gap he focused on as he imposed a 39% tariff on Swiss goods.

title: An Unusual Soccer Finale in Italy Reveals Libya’s Frailties
summary: With two governments, and two soccer leagues, Libya is holding its soccer championship in Italy for a second year. Volatile politics and fans follow.

title: Is Kim Jong-un Preparing a Successor?
summary: Kim Jong-un, the leader of North Korea, might be preparing his young daughter, Kim Ju-ae, to become his successor. Choe Sang-Hun, the ​Seoul bureau chief for The New York Times, analyzed North Korean state propaganda to find out.

title: William H. Webster, Who Ran Both the F.B.I. and the C.I.A., Dies at 101
summary: A former federal judge, he first came to the F.B.I. just as two of the worst spies in American history were running rampant.

title: Texas Attorney General Moves to Oust Democrats From Office Over Walkout
summary: Democratic lawmakers maintained their walkout to thwart a Republican gerrymander, prompting Ken Paxton to ask the state’s Supreme Court to remove 13 of them from their seats.

title: At ‘Alligator Alcatraz,’ Did a Detainee Just Faint or Need CPR?
summary: Homeland Security says a detainee fainted. But other accounts say the man was unconscious. One witness said the guards did not seem to know how to check his pulse.

title: ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ in the Florida Everglades Is Testing Environmental Law
summary: Officials building a Florida detention center appear to be skipping environmental reviews made mandatory decades ago after a fight over an airport at the very same spot.

title: ICE Is Holding Migrants in Crowded and Unsanitary Cells, Suit Claims
summary: The Immigration and Customs Enforcement facilities in New York have been used to detain migrants for days. U.S. officials have denied that the conditions are poor.

title: Astronaut James Lovell, Commander of Apollo 13, Dies at 97
summary: He led the three-man crew that survived a near catastrophic explosion in space in 1970, and was later immortalized by Tom Hanks in the movie “Apollo 13.”

title: ‘Hunting Wives,’ a Raunchy and Pulpy Drama, Is Netflix’s Most Popular Show
summary: The drama has all the ingredients of a binge-watch: culture wars, murder and sex.

title: Seed Oils Are Fine, Really
summary: Nutrition science demonizing individual foods or ingredients is often based on flawed science and misses the bigger picture.

title: Akiko Takakura Survived Atomic Bombing. This is Her Story.
summary: Akiko Takakura survived the atomic bombing of Hiroshima. This is her story, in her words.

title: Suspect in Deadly Montana Bar Shooting Is Captured, Official Says
summary: An Army veteran wanted in connection with the killing of four people at a bar in the town of Anaconda was taken into custody on Friday after an eight-day manhunt.

title: Thousands of Dollars Worth of Labubus Stolen From California Store
summary: Demand for the trendy dolls, elf-like creatures with nine-tooth grins, has people lining up for hours to buy them.

title: ‘Chimp Crazy’ Star Gets Nearly 4 Years in Prison for Lying About Ape’s Death
summary: Prosecutors said that Tonia Haddix perjured herself to avoid giving up custody of Tonka, who had appeared in the movies ‘George of the Jungle’ and ‘Buddy.’
